p: The aim of this study was to detect and characterize the relaxation behavior of CH 2, CH 3, and n‐3 CH 3 signals in oils, with an assessment of their apparent T 2 relaxation times and their n‐3 FA content, and to detect and quantify n‐3 CH 3 signal in vivo in SAT with a long TE at 7 T. For this purpose, we aimed to modify the PRESS sequence for UHF and validated the MRS data by gas chromatography analysis.
